name: chub
content:
chub noun
(FISH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] plural chub or or chubs a type of fish found in rivers: He caught a 6 pound chub in the River Wear.
Reinhard Dirscherl/The Image Bank/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesIt was a proud moment when the boy caught a six-inch chub from the creek.In addition to losing its habitat, the chub also must contend with foreign predators, particularly warm-water game fish.Cattle can damage the water sources the chub and frog rely on.They netted two adult and two juvenile chubs from a small pond.

chub noun
(MEAT)
[ C or U ] US a food product consisting of minced meat in packaging shaped like a large thick sausage: They sell ground beef in the form of frozen patties and fresh, refrigerated chubs. a turkey chub Our ground turkey chub is naturally lean with 70 percent less fat than ground beef.
EllenM/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe dog food comes as raw meat in the form of patties, medallions, or chubs.The one-pound package of chubs has a suggested retail price of $3.99 to $5.99.She buys two-pound chicken chubs for her cats.
